18namespace v8 {
19namespace internal {
20namespace compiler {
21
22// Find the first place to insert new nodes in a block that's already been
23// scheduled that won't upset the register allocator.
24static NodeVector::iterator FindInsertionPoint(BasicBlock* block) {
25 NodeVector::iterator i = block->begin();
26 for (; i != block->end(); ++i) {
27 const Operator* op = (*i)->op();
28 if (OperatorProperties::IsBasicBlockBegin(op)) continue;
29 switch (op->opcode()) {
30 case IrOpcode::kParameter:
31 case IrOpcode::kPhi:
32 case IrOpcode::kEffectPhi:
33 continue;
34 }
35 break;
36 }
37 return i;
38}
39
40static const Operator* IntPtrConstant(CommonOperatorBuilder* common,
41 intptr_t value) {
42 return kSystemPointerSize == 8
43 ? common->Int64Constant(value)
44 : common->Int32Constant(static_cast<int32_t>(value));
45}
46
47// TODO(dcarney): need to mark code as non-serializable.
48static const Operator* PointerConstant(CommonOperatorBuilder* common,
49 const void* ptr) {
50 intptr_t ptr_as_int = reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(ptr);
51 return IntPtrConstant(common, ptr_as_int);
52}
53
54BasicBlockProfilerData* BasicBlockInstrumentor::Instrument(
55 OptimizedCompilationInfo* info, Graph* graph, Schedule* schedule,
56 Isolate* isolate) {
57 // Basic block profiling disables concurrent compilation, so handle deref is
58 // fine.
59 AllowHandleDereference allow_handle_dereference;
60 // Skip the exit block in profiles, since the register allocator can't handle
61 // it and entry into it means falling off the end of the function anyway.
62 size_t n_blocks = schedule->RpoBlockCount();
63 BasicBlockProfilerData* data = BasicBlockProfiler::Get()->NewData(n_blocks);
64 // Set the function name.
65 data->SetFunctionName(info->GetDebugName());
66 // Capture the schedule string before instrumentation.
67 if (v8_flags.turbo_profiling_verbose) {
68 std::ostringstream os;
69 os << *schedule;
70 data->SetSchedule(os);
71 }
72 // Check whether we should write counts to a JS heap object or to the
73 // BasicBlockProfilerData directly. The JS heap object is only used for
74 // builtins.
75 bool on_heap_counters = isolate && isolate->IsGeneratingEmbeddedBuiltins();
76 // Add the increment instructions to the start of every block.
77 CommonOperatorBuilder common(graph->zone());
78 MachineOperatorBuilder machine(graph->zone());
79 Node* counters_array = nullptr;
80 if (on_heap_counters) {
81 // Allocation is disallowed here, so rather than referring to an actual
82 // counters array, create a reference to a special marker object. This
83 // object will get fixed up later in the constants table (see
84 // PatchBasicBlockCountersReference). An important and subtle point: we
85 // cannot use the root handle basic_block_counters_marker_handle() and must
86 // create a new separate handle. Otherwise
87 // MacroAssemblerBase::IndirectLoadConstant would helpfully emit a
88 // root-relative load rather than putting this value in the constants table
89 // where we expect it to be for patching.
90 counters_array = graph->NewNode(common.HeapConstant(Handle<HeapObject>::New(
91 ReadOnlyRoots(isolate).basic_block_counters_marker(), isolate)));
92 } else {
93 counters_array = graph->NewNode(PointerConstant(&common, data->counts()));
94 }
95 Node* zero = graph->NewNode(common.Int32Constant(0));
96 Node* one = graph->NewNode(common.Int32Constant(1));
97 BasicBlockVector* blocks = schedule->rpo_order();
98 size_t block_number = 0;
99 for (BasicBlockVector::iterator it = blocks->begin(); block_number < n_blocks;
100 ++it, ++block_number) {
101 BasicBlock* block = (*it);
102 if (block == schedule->end()) continue;
103 // Iteration is already in reverse post-order.
104 DCHECK_EQ(block->rpo_number(), block_number);
105 data->SetBlockId(block_number, block->id().ToInt());
106 // It is unnecessary to wire effect and control deps for load and store
107 // since this happens after scheduling.
108 // Construct increment operation.
109 int offset_to_counter_value = static_cast<int>(block_number) * kInt32Size;
110 if (on_heap_counters) {
111 offset_to_counter_value += ByteArray::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag;
112 }
113 Node* offset_to_counter =
114 graph->NewNode(IntPtrConstant(&common, offset_to_counter_value));
115 Node* load =
116 graph->NewNode(machine.Load(MachineType::Uint32()), counters_array,
117 offset_to_counter, graph->start(), graph->start());
118 Node* inc = graph->NewNode(machine.Int32Add(), load, one);
119
120 // Branchless saturation, because we've already run the scheduler, so
121 // introducing extra control flow here would be surprising.
122 Node* overflow = graph->NewNode(machine.Uint32LessThan(), inc, load);
123 Node* overflow_mask = graph->NewNode(machine.Int32Sub(), zero, overflow);
124 Node* saturated_inc =
125 graph->NewNode(machine.Word32Or(), inc, overflow_mask);
126
127 Node* store =
128 graph->NewNode(machine.Store(StoreRepresentation(
129 MachineRepresentation::kWord32, kNoWriteBarrier)),
130 counters_array, offset_to_counter, saturated_inc,
131 graph->start(), graph->start());
132 // Insert the new nodes.
133 static const int kArraySize = 10;
134 Node* to_insert[kArraySize] = {
135 counters_array, zero, one, offset_to_counter,
136 load, inc, overflow, overflow_mask,
137 saturated_inc, store};
138 // The first three Nodes are constant across all blocks.
139 int insertion_start = block_number == 0 ? 0 : 3;
140 NodeVector::iterator insertion_point = FindInsertionPoint(block);
141 block->InsertNodes(insertion_point, &to_insert[insertion_start],
142 &to_insert[kArraySize]);
143 // Tell the scheduler about the new nodes.
144 for (int i = insertion_start; i < kArraySize; ++i) {
145 schedule->SetBlockForNode(block, to_insert[i]);
146 }
147 // The exit block is not instrumented and so we must ignore that block
148 // count.
149 if (block->control() == BasicBlock::kBranch &&
150 block->successors()[0] != schedule->end() &&
151 block->successors()[1] != schedule->end()) {
152 data->AddBranch(block->successors()[0]->id().ToInt(),
153 block->successors()[1]->id().ToInt());
154 }
155 }
156 return data;
157}
158
159namespace {
160
161void StoreBuiltinCallForNode(Node* n, Builtin builtin, int block_id,
162 BuiltinsCallGraph* bcc_profiler) {
163 if (n == nullptr) return;
164 IrOpcode::Value op = n->opcode();
165 if (op == IrOpcode::kCall || op == IrOpcode::kTailCall) {
166 const CallDescriptor* des = CallDescriptorOf(n->op());
167 if (des->kind() == CallDescriptor::kCallCodeObject) {
168 Node* callee = n->InputAt(0);
169 Operator* op = const_cast<Operator*>(callee->op());
170 if (op->opcode() == IrOpcode::kHeapConstant) {
171 Handle<HeapObject> para = OpParameter<Handle<HeapObject>>(op);
172 if (IsCode(*para)) {
173 Handle<Code> code = Handle<Code>::cast(para);
174 if (code->is_builtin()) {
175 bcc_profiler->AddBuiltinCall(builtin, code->builtin_id(), block_id);
176 return;
177 }
178 }
179 }
180 }
181 }
182}
183
184} // namespace
185
186void BasicBlockCallGraphProfiler::StoreCallGraph(OptimizedCompilationInfo* info,
187 Schedule* schedule) {
188 CHECK(Builtins::IsBuiltinId(info->builtin()));
189 BasicBlockVector* blocks = schedule->rpo_order();
190 size_t block_number = 0;
191 size_t n_blocks = schedule->RpoBlockCount();
192 for (BasicBlockVector::iterator it = blocks->begin(); block_number < n_blocks;
193 ++it, ++block_number) {
194 BasicBlock* block = (*it);
195 if (block == schedule->end()) continue;
196 // Iteration is already in reverse post-order.
197 DCHECK_EQ(block->rpo_number(), block_number);
198 int block_id = block->id().ToInt();
199
200 BuiltinsCallGraph* profiler = BuiltinsCallGraph::Get();
201
202 for (Node* node : *block) {
203 StoreBuiltinCallForNode(node, info->builtin(), block_id, profiler);
204 }
205
206 BasicBlock::Control control = block->control();
207 if (control != BasicBlock::kNone) {
208 Node* cnt_node = block->control_input();
209 StoreBuiltinCallForNode(cnt_node, info->builtin(), block_id, profiler);
210 }
211 }
212}

214} // namespace compiler
